pr_title: Modularize and Refactor the Debezium Tutorial

timeline.bodyText:
This note does not seem to be aligned with what we convey at https://debezium.io/releases/, as we indicate that the 1.1 version was tested with both Connect 1.x and 2.x.  I also don't think anything we make reference to here is specific to Connect 2.4 versions previous versions either.
@gunnarmorling @jpechane , I think we should reword/omit this but wanted your opinions.  I'm pondering if we could point the user to the releases tested with matrix?
timeline.author: Naros
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,63 @@
+// Metadata created by nebel
+//
+// ParentAssemblies: assemblies/tutorial/as_starting-services.adoc
+// UserStory:
+
+[id="starting-kafka"]
+= Starting Kafka
+
+After starting ZooKeeper, you can start Kafka in a new container.
+
+[NOTE]

replies.bodyText: I think having the explicit version mention of that one AK version is fine/reasonable for downstream. For upstream I'd indeed omit it, as you say referring to the test matrix would be nice. So another include for this snippet then?
replies.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: So commit 6fa8f40 should now produce differing notes for upstream/downstream as requested.
replies.author: Naros

timeline.message: Add reference to test matrix compatibility for upstream only
